means: easy-to-use novice-oriented Texas Instruments computer environment 面向初学者的简易得克萨斯仪器计算机环境

sentence.Network_en: Retailers have tried almost everything to entice shoppers through their doors.
sentence.Network_cn: 零售商们几乎尝试了所有办法以吸引购物者进入商店。

sentence.Network_en: The bargain prices are expected to entice customers away from other stores.
sentence.Network_cn: 低廉的价格意在把顾客从其他商店吸引过来。

sentence.Network_en: Higher education grants are a carrot with which to entice students.
sentence.Network_cn: 高等教育的助学金是吸引学生的诱惑物.

PerfectNetExp.abs: TOEIC词汇汇总 ... disposition 倾向；性格；气质；性情 7. entice 诱惑；引诱 9. fondness 钟爱；溺爱；嗜好；癖好 11.
啖_百度百科 ... ⒋给吃[ feed] ⒍用饵或好象用饵勾引；引诱[ bait;entice] 啗、啖、啖 dàn.
enthrall 迷住entice 吸引,引诱entitle 给与名称,使有资格,使有权利
GRE词汇精选（核心词汇） ... enthralling 迷人的，吸引人的 entice 怂恿，引诱 entirety 整体，全面.

list.abs: cut back on sugar . stress hormones and brain chemicals might entice you to nibble on sweets , but remember , the first two bites satisfy brain chemistry . anything after that is pure indulgence .削减糖的摄入。应激激素和脑化学物质可能会吸引你吃糖，但请记住，吃两口就足以满足大脑需要。再多吃就纯属放纵了。
people entice you to join in will be less than trustworthy .那些怂恿你加入的人是不值得信任的。
enticements gradually included nifty water-proof swollen thorns to live in , handy nectar fountains , and special ant-food buds atleaf tips .诱饵渐渐囊括了可供蚂蚁居住的防水的漂亮巨刺，现成的蜜露泉，和专为蚂蚁准备的食物——叶尖嫩苞。
outside the store , meanwhile , touts try to entice customers in laminated pamphlets offering up to 25 per cent off the listed price .与此同时，在店外，券贩子正试图吸引顾客进店，他们手里拿着促销券，提供的折扣高达店内明示价格的25%。
they enticed a young girl away from home .他们诱骗了一个少女离家出走。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also in the sense 'incite, provoke'; formerly also as intice): from Old French enticier, probably from a base meaning 'set on fire', based on an alteration of Latin titio 'firebrand'

entry.def: To entice someone to go somewhere or to do something means to try to persuade them to go to that place or to do that thing.

example.ex: Retailers have tried almost everything to entice shoppers through their doors...
example.tran: 零售商们几乎尝试了所有办法以吸引购物者进入商店。

example.ex: Child murderers in the past have very often carried photographs of young children to entice their victims away...
example.tran: 过去儿童谋杀犯常常携带一些小孩子的照片来诱拐他们的受害者。

means.word_mean: 1. provoke someone to do something through (often false or exaggerated) promises or persuasion;

sentences.en: An attempt is being made to entice otters back to the river.
sentences.cn: 人们正试图把水獭引诱回河里去。

sentences.en: Higher education grants are a carrot with which to entice students.
sentences.cn: 高等教育的助学金是吸引学生的诱惑物。
